presets.name: Competitor Analysis
presets.description: Compare feature parity and user perceptions across competing products. Track what users like about competitors and switching triggers.
presets.author: OpenInsights

tags.name: We Have
tags.description: Feature we have that competitors lack

tags.name: They Have
tags.description: Feature competitors have that we lack

tags.name: Switch To Them If
tags.description: Reasons users would switch to competitor

tags.name: Switch To Us If
tags.description: Reasons users would switch to us

aiPrompts.autoTaggingPrompt:
Identify competitive intelligence:
- Direct competitor mentions and comparisons
- Feature parity observations (we have, they have, both have)
- Perception statements (better, worse, similar)
- Switching triggers (what would make them switch)

Tag each mention with the appropriate category.
aiPrompts.projectSummaryPrompt:
Create a competitive analysis summary:
1. Feature comparison matrix
2. Perception summary by competitor
3. Top switching triggers (both directions)
4. Opportunity areas where we can differentiate

projectSettings.goals: Understand competitive positioning and identify differentiation opportunities

presets.name: Customer Feedback Synthesis
presets.description: Analyze customer feedback from reviews, support tickets, or surveys. Automatically classify sentiment, topics, and actionability.
presets.author: OpenInsights

tags.name: Out of Scope
tags.description: Not feasible or aligned with strategy

aiPrompts.autoTaggingPrompt:
Analyze the feedback and classify:
1. Sentiment (positive, neutral, negative)
2. Primary topic (pricing, performance, UX, feature, bug, support)
3. Actionability (quick fix, roadmap, out of scope)

Extract specific requests or issues mentioned.
aiPrompts.projectSummaryPrompt:
Synthesize all feedback to provide:
1. Sentiment breakdown by source and segment
2. Top topics by frequency and sentiment
3. Prioritized list of actionable items
4. Key quotes representing each major theme

projectSettings.goals: Synthesize customer feedback to identify trends, issues, and opportunities

presets.name: Jobs-to-be-Done Interview
presets.description: For analyzing customer switching decisions using the JTBD framework. Tracks the timeline from first thought to satisfaction, plus the four forces that influence adoption.
presets.author: OpenInsights

tags.name: First Thought
tags.description: When they first realized they needed a change

aiPrompts.autoTaggingPrompt:
Identify key moments in the customer's switching journey:
- Triggering events that started the search
- Comparison moments with alternatives
- The deciding moment
- Forces at play (push, pull, anxiety, habit)

Tag each moment with the appropriate timeline stage or force.
aiPrompts.projectSummaryPrompt:
Synthesize the customer journeys to identify:
1. Common triggering events
2. Key decision criteria
3. Strongest push and pull forces
4. Main anxieties and how they were overcome

Create a composite customer timeline with insights.

projectSettings.goals: Understand why customers switch between solutions and what drives their decisions

presets.name: Usability Test Analysis
presets.description: Complete setup for moderated usability tests. Track task completion, friction points, and user emotions during usability testing sessions.
presets.author: OpenInsights

tags.name: Task Partial
tags.description: User completed with difficulty or assistance

tags.name: Task Failure
tags.description: User could not complete the task

tags.name: Hesitation
tags.description: User pauses or hesitates before action

tags.name: Misclick
tags.description: User clicks wrong element or takes wrong path

tags.name: Workaround
tags.description: User finds alternative way to complete task

tags.name: Delight
tags.description: User expresses positive surprise or satisfaction

tags.name: Surprise
tags.description: User reacts unexpectedly to UI behavior

aiPrompts.autoTaggingPrompt:
Analyze the transcript and identify moments where:
- User expresses confusion ("I don't understand", "where is", pauses > 3 sec)
- User makes an error or takes an unexpected path
- User expresses emotion (frustration, delight, surprise)
- User explicitly requests a feature or workaround

For each moment, suggest the most appropriate tag from the available taxonomy.
aiPrompts.projectSummaryPrompt:
Based on the tagged highlights across all sessions, identify:
1. Top 5 recurring friction points by frequency
2. Patterns that appear in 3+ sessions
3. Critical severity issues (blocking task completion)

Group findings by theme and suggest priority order.

projectSettings.goals: Identify usability issues and friction points in the user experience
